ygData.subject: Re: Creating Magical Armor and Weapons
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah forget what the book said and all that stuff. reread your FaQ and the official guide to EQ, magical weapons are supposed to require the help of a high
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah forget what the book said and all that stuff.
reread your FaQ and the "official" guide to EQ, magical weapons are
supposed to require the help of a high level enchanter and a master
smith, the one things we shouldn't need is to deal with a slimy little
dwarven smith or some such ;)
as for "would become the best class to make magical items." well I
should hope so, its what our class does! what next? Take away damage
bonuses for str to fighters cause it might make them the best melee
class in the game? or pickpockets from rogues cause it might make them
the best rogues in the game? heh, don't mess with us enchanters or
you'll regret it
sincerily
Louie the kneebreaker
aka nosferatu aka Phebos gnome enchantress, master smith, master jewler,
just plain master ala Sol Ro

Paul Hill wrote:
>
> From: "Paul Hill" <paul@...>
>
> Here is my 2 cents worth on this subject. I say no to enchanters being able
> to enchant ore for us. I agree that the enchanters would become the best
> class to make magical items. Let them do what they do best and make pretty
> jewelry for us to wear.
>
> How can we make magical weapons and armor? I like the idea of the mold.
> Also maybe introduce special ore that can be used to make enchanted weapons
> and armor. Of course this ore would have to be dropped by creatures and not
> bought from NPC's. Or maybe combine different ingredients into the ore like
> snakeskin for poison resistance, lightstones to give of light radius. Maybe
> use a combination of all the above to make unique or lore items, like a
> special mold, magical ore, snakefang, and a lightstone to make a special
> sword that causes poison and gives off a lightradius of a lightstone.
>
> Karudil the Wandering Shaman of Ro
> 17th Level <The Shadows>
> Tarew Marr
